#Text=Research Salary Ranges and Benefits for a Veterinarian
#Text=One way to begin preparing for a career is to learn about the salary and benefits typically offered to members of the considered profession .
#Text=When researching veterinarian salary ranges and benefits , there are a number of resources available to you over the Internet .
#Text=Using multiple sources will allow you to develop a realistic understanding of the earnings you might expect .
#Text=Salary research can give you an advantage when considering whether to pursue a career and when negotiating a salary with an employer , either at the time of hire or during review .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Determine the type of veterinary work you want to research .
#Text=There are a number of different jobs within the veterinary field , including veterinary technicians , nurses and veterinarians .
#Text=Each position may require different education and training .
#Text=Before you begin to research veterinarian salary ranges , make note of those jobs within the field that most interest you .
#Text=Write down your work and educational history for reference .
#Text=Be sure to include details about your highest educational level and the number of years you have worked within the veterinarian field .
#Text=When you begin research with some sources , you will need to refer to this data in order to retrieve the most accurate results .
#Text=Collect salary information for the type of position and level you are researching .
#Text=The United States Department of Labor and veterinary associations are reliable resources from which to gather salary information .
#Text=You can also research veterinarian salary ranges at the state level by contacting your state 's department of labor .
#Text=Some job boards , such as Monster , also provide salary information through third-party resources .
#Text=Note what reported salaries include , beyond hourly or annual pay .

#Text=Sometimes , when salary information is reported , it includes benefits , bonuses , vacation and sick time , company-sponsored insurance plans and company contributions to retirement plans and stock options .
#Text=By reading carefully , you will be able to understand exactly what comprises each reported salary for a given job title within the veterinary field .
#Text=Sites that report salaries in this way enable you to research veterinary benefits while investigating salary information as well .
#Text=Analyze the results .
#Text=It 's possible , and likely , that results will vary somewhat depending on the source .
#Text=Some sources , such as salary calculators found on many job boards , gather their data by asking visitors to input information related to their job and career .
#Text=Other sources report directly from employers .
#Text=Sources such as industry associations might poll association members ( this is important to note if the association is affiliated with a particular university or state ) .
#Text=When analyzing your research , remember to consider such elements as repayment of student loans ( if applicable ) and the cost of living in your current or intended area .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Gather information from as many reliable sources as possible .
#Text=This will enable you to develop a more accurate understanding of your research .
#Text=Keep your expectations realistic .
#Text=Before beginning your research , avoid making presumptions about how much you will earn as a veterinarian or what benefits you will receive .
